incident_updates.body: Between 2024-05-04 18:00 UTC to 2024-05-04 22:00 UTC, one of our insights data sources containing field usage stats was not ingesting data. This affects all graphs for that time window, and a small number of graphs for up to 1 day before the start time. Within these times, you may notice missing field usage data on the Insights page. We are working on a way to limit the impact to just affecting client attribution of field usage and we will update this incident when we have updates.
This incident has been resolved. We appreciate your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused.
We are beginning to see recovery in our services. We will continue to monitor the situation and update the incident shortly.
We have identified the issue and have applied a fix.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating failures in GraphQL API. You may see some errors throughout the platform.

incidents.name: Lint Checks failing to report Composition Hints

incident_updates.body: Rollback has successfully fixed the issue. We will be conducting a postmortem this week. We appreciate your patience.

We deployed code that caused Composition Hints to not be reported in Lint Check tasks. Composition hints and errors were accurately reported for publishes and Build tasks in checks. 

Users with checks configured to fail on Lint Composition Hints will have seen checks pass incorrectly.

incidents.name: Use of "rover dev" on Linux impacted by GitHub "Unauthorized" error

incident_updates.body: We are confident that things are working correctly and marking this incident as resolved.

We have mitigated the impact on Linux users of "rover dev" by changing the way that we follow redirects to GitHub.  This compensates for a change that manifested in the way GitHub serves assets from their CDN which resulted in HEAD requests returning 401 where the GET requests worked properly.   This mitgation should be transparent for all users.

We have confirmed that "rover dev" for Linux is working again and we will monitor the continued necessity of the mitigation.  We appreciate your patience during the investigation.

We are currently investigating an upstream unavailability of the Linux Router binary which is downloaded and invoked by the "rover dev" CLI command in Rover.  Other architectures (like macOS) do not seem to be impacted.  We are investigating the cause.

incidents.name: Erroneous Warnings in Router Logs for Enterprise Features

incident_updates.body:
We investigated and resolved an isolated number of cases where Router users utilizing Enterprise Features (e.g., JWT Authentication, Operation Limits, Distributed Caching, Subscriptions, etc.) were receiving error messages in their Router logs (or telemetry products like Datadog, etc.) which stated “License has expired” or “Apollo license expired”, despite the fact that their Enterprise plan was active and current.  The exact error message depended on the Router version and the features used and would have started appearing on Wed, Nov 15, 2023 at 12:00:00 PM GMT.

As noted above, this is already resolved and we will follow-up on this to prevent this from occurring in the future.  All such log messages should have stopped as of Mon, Nov 20, 2023 at 21:07:00 UTC.

If you are curious, you can always verify the activeness of your Graph’s account by visiting the Graph’s “Settings > Billing” page in Studio.

Please contact Support through the Studio dashboard or reach out to your account representative if you continue to see these messages appearing in your log.

Priority: Partially Degraded
Components: Uplink
Resolved at: Nov 20, 2023 at 21:07:00 UTC

incidents.name: Checks failing to update Github status

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

At 23:12 UTC Apollo observed elevated levels of failures syncing Github statuses from our Checks feature. While investigating this, we were unable to discern the customer impact during this time. As of 23:56 UTC we saw the health return to normal and were able to understand that the impact here was that no Github statuses would have been updated during this period of time, but that the core of our Checks offering was perfectly fine.

Ironically, this was caused by some hardening preparation for the C5/BFCM/Holiday season, and as such we will be updating our procedures to make sure that this doesn't happen again in the run up.

The timestamps of this StatusPage incident have been retroactively updated to reflect the timestamps involved here so that your tracking systems and monitoring are easier to align.

As always, we appreciate your patience.

incident_updates.body:
In an efforts to continuously dogfood the Router before getting it into customer hands, we rolled a release of the Router out into production. After seeing things being stable in our testing, we rolled this out more broadly and saw issues underlying the changes themselves. We immediately switched traffic off of the test and back to our baseline pods to resolve the customer impact.

We apologize for the outage, and as always appreciate your patience.
We are currently investigating this issue.

GitHub is currently experiencing a widespread outage (see https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/c8zjb9351hlc) which affects the CDN distribution for installers for Rover and router. Our team is closely monitoring the situation, and we will provide updates as soon as the service is stable. Thank you for your patience.

incidents.name: Partial outage of some schema check and legacy operation registry features

incident_updates.body: Between 2023-05-31 15:51 and 16:46 UTC, access to some GraphOS features relating to schema checks and the legacy operation registry failed with error messages such as "Schema validation is not available on your organization's plan" and "The operation registry is not available on your organization's plan". The issue has been resolved.
Services are fully operational.
Our upstream provider has stabilized. Creating and updating Cloud Routers should be functioning normally, but we are actively monitoring the situation to ensure safe and reliable use of our services.

incidents.name: Query plans not appearing in Studio user interfaces

incident_updates.body: The incident impacting the query planner previews in our Studio user interface has been resolved.  We appreciate your patience.
We continue to deploy the fix and will provide additional updates, and resolution, soon.
We believe we've identified the cause and are deploying a fix.

Following upgrades, Apollo Studio is not display query plans for _some_ Federation 2.x versions in both the Apollo Studio Explorer query-plan preview pane and query plans shown in the "Traces" view on the "Operations" page.

This does not impact executing operations.  We believe this is only affecting Studio Explorer, but we will continue to investigate and keep you posted.

incidents.name: Delay in using new api keys in uplink

incident_updates.body: All graph API tokens have been backfilled and are present in uplink.

We have rolled out a fix so newly created graph API keys are working with uplink.

We are still working on backfilling the api keys created between 2023-05-08 18:35 UTC and 2023-05-08 17:50 UTC.
Newly create graph API keys created are unable to fetch from uplink.

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incident_updates.body: We are declaring this incident resolved as our routing error rate has remained at 0% after applying the fix.  We are confident in the fix at this time, but we will conduct an internal post-mortem on this and evaluate any additional necessary follow-up work to prevent an incident like this from recurring.  Again, thank you for your patience.
We have applied a fix to components in our infrastructure to resolve the routing interruption.  We are continuing to monitor the situation closely.  We appreciate your patience!

We are experiencing issues with routing traffic to Cloud Routers due to a capacity issue. Traffic to Cloud Routers, as well as provisioning Cloud Routers are currently impaired. Our team is working to fix the issue, and we will provide updates as soon as the service is stable. Thank you for your patience.
